verses.plain: Then answered Zophar the Naamathite, and said,

tokens.t: Then answered Zophar the Naamathite, and said,

verses.plain: Should not the multitude of words be answered? and should a man full of talk be justified?

tokens.t: Should not the multitude of words be answered? and should a man full of talk be justified?

verses.plain: Should thy lies make men hold their peace? and when thou mockest, shall no man make thee ashamed?

tokens.t: Should thy lies make men hold their peace? and when thou mockest, shall no man make thee ashamed?

verses.plain: For thou hast said, My doctrine is pure, and I am clean in thine eyes.

tokens.t: For thou hast said, My doctrine
pure, and I am clean in thine eyes.

verses.plain: But oh that God would speak, and open his lips against thee;

tokens.t: But oh that God would speak, and open his lips against thee;

verses.plain: And that he would shew thee the secrets of wisdom, that they are double to that which is! Know therefore that God exacteth of thee less than thine iniquity deserveth.

tokens.t: And that he would shew thee the secrets of wisdom, that
double to that which is! Know therefore that God exacteth of thee
than thine iniquity

verses.plain: Canst thou by searching find out God? canst thou find out the Almighty unto perfection?

tokens.t: Canst thou by searching find out God? canst thou find out the Almighty unto perfection?

verses.plain: It is as high as heaven; what canst thou do? deeper than hell; what canst thou know?

tokens.t: as high as heaven; what canst thou do? deeper than hell; what canst thou know?

verses.plain: The measure thereof is longer than the earth, and broader than the sea.

tokens.t: The measure thereof
longer than the earth, and broader than the sea.

verses.plain: If he cut off, and shut up, or gather together, then who can hinder him?

tokens.t: If he cut off, and shut up, or gather together, then who can hinder him?

verses.plain: For he knoweth vain men: he seeth wickedness also; will he not then consider it?

tokens.t: For he knoweth vain men: he seeth wickedness also; will he not then consider

verses.plain: For vain man would be wise, though man be born like a wild ass’s colt.

tokens.t: For vain man would be wise, though man be born
a wild ass’s colt.

verses.plain: If thou prepare thine heart, and stretch out thine hands toward him;

tokens.t: If thou prepare thine heart, and stretch out thine hands toward him;

verses.plain: If iniquity be in thine hand, put it far away, and let not wickedness dwell in thy tabernacles.

tokens.t: If iniquity
in thine hand, put it far away, and let not wickedness dwell in thy tabernacles.

verses.plain: For then shalt thou lift up thy face without spot; yea, thou shalt be stedfast, and shalt not fear:

tokens.t: For then shalt thou lift up thy face without spot; yea, thou shalt be stedfast, and shalt not fear:

verses.plain: Because thou shalt forget thy misery, and remember it as waters that pass away:

tokens.t: Because thou shalt forget
misery,
remember
as waters
pass away:

verses.plain: And thine age shall be clearer than the noonday; thou shalt shine forth, thou shalt be as the morning.

tokens.t: And
age shall be clearer than the noonday; thou shalt shine forth, thou shalt be as the morning.

verses.plain: And thou shalt be secure, because there is hope; yea, thou shalt dig about thee, and thou shalt take thy rest in safety.

tokens.t: And thou shalt be secure, because there is hope; yea, thou shalt dig
thou shalt take thy rest in safety.

verses.plain: Also thou shalt lie down, and none shall make thee afraid; yea, many shall make suit unto thee.

tokens.t: Also thou shalt lie down, and none shall make
afraid; yea, many shall make suit unto thee.

verses.plain: But the eyes of the wicked shall fail, and they shall not escape, and their hope shall be as the giving up of the ghost.

tokens.t: But the eyes of the wicked shall fail, and they shall not escape, and their hope
the giving up of the ghost.

footnotes.text: as high…: Heb. the heights of heaven
make suit…: Heb. intreat thy face
they shall…: Heb. flight shall perish from them
the giving…: or, a puff of breath
